title: Potential energy - system of particles expanding

content.description: Two particles of a certain type interact with each other with a repulsive conservative force with magnitude <math alttext="F equals the fraction alpha over r cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>α</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac></math> where <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>α</mi></math> is a constant and <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance between the particles. A system of four such particles is held together to form a triangular pyramid with a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>d</mi></math> between each pair of particles, as shown in the figure.
content.question:
The four particles are simultaneously released from rest. Which of the following best describes the potential energy of the system and the magnitude of the acceleration of one of the particles after they are released?
Potential EnergyAccelerationADecreasingDecreasingBDecreasingIncreasingCIncreasingDecreasingDIncreasingIncreasing
